qas.question: Which two coastal regions are now major tourist destinations?

answers.text: Rías Baixas and Santiago de Compostela

qas.question: How many tourists visited Galicia in 2007?
What percentage of its GDP is tourism responsible for?

context: Galicia was late to catch the tourism boom that has swept Spain in recent decades, but the coastal regions (especially the <a0_0>Rías Baixas and Santiago de Compostela<a0_0/>) are now significant tourist destinations and are especially popular with visitors from other regions in Spain, where the majority of tourists come from. In 2007, <a1_0>5.7 million<a1_0/> tourists visited Galicia, an 8% growth over the previous year, and part of a continual pattern of growth in this sector. 85% of tourists who visit Galicia visit Santiago de Compostela. Tourism constitutes <a2_0>12%<a2_0/> of Galician GDP and employs about 12% of the regional workforce.
